Here are 100 100-digit random numbers, numbered from 0 to 99:
First I show an example of a subset of these numbers and the sum of
  this subset.
Then I give you a different sum  of a different subset of these
  numbers and ask for the subset producing that sum.
So you must find the subset that adds up to the final sum I give below.

99: 6016235329433901258591000794596681831481196324324680930576033291443854111044337464109389765032545221

Let's suppose these are in array locations: a[0] to a[99]
Let b be the array of 0's and 1's:
b = 1011000001001100111110001111111001001001101110011010110001110011011001101100001001110100110001010001
The ith element of the array b is just the ith element of the string above.
We can use b to determine which elements of a to add up:
  if b has a 1 at location i, add in a[i], and otherwise not.
   (51 elements added, 49 elements not added.)
Here is the result of adding up the elements of a where b has a 1:
    242754876749018392922402171691010132782733742191002071805918848176200374959569618348720270356296429967
Similarly, here is the sum where b has a 0:
    238682349723540423475245418459809092850630800716152139619068210306806704407271075281412006155101239161
Here is the sum of all the elements of a, the sum of the two numbers above:
    481437226472558816397647590150819225633364542907154211424987058483007079366840693630132276511397669128

Here is the sum of another subset of elements of a, completely different from the one above:
    271890173684401751109835939563811494275335288909673663928100804911859067821818856293096434404911141105
You need to determine an array c of 0s and 1s, so that if you add up
  elements of a where c has a 1, you get the sum above, the last one, starting 2718...

Good luck,
Neal R. Wagner
